summary: The Campus Accountability and Safety Act (S. 2990) amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 and the Clery Act to combat campus sexual assault, harassment, and other forms of interpersonal violence. The bill mandates increased transparency in reporting, including the creation of a publicly accessible website providing information on campus safety, reporting options, and federal investigations. It requires institutions to establish campus security policies, including the designation of sexual and interpersonal violence specialists, and focuses on training and support for survivors. The bill also amends the Violence Against Women and Department of Justice Reauthorization Act to include sexual harassment in grant programs for combating campus violence.
